definition: to hit the target (esp. in argument)/to strike home
definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
to hit the target and do real damage (idiom)/fig. to hit where it hurts/fig. to hit home/an argument that hits the nail on the head
to hit home on the evils of the day (idiom); fig. to hit a current political target/to hit the nub of the matter
to hit the target where it hurts (idiom); fig. to hit home/to hit the nail on the head (in an argument)

sentences.english: Your answer isn't to the point.
sentences.chinese: 你的答案未能切中要害。

sentences.english: They are terser, more to the point and less euphuistic.
sentences.chinese: 它们更为简洁，更加切中要点，而更少止于华丽词藻。

sentences.english: Your last remark really hit the bull's eye, it was exactly right.
sentences.chinese: 你最后的一句话切中要害，对极了。

sentences.english: The best way to convey clout is to write the paper from a third-person point of view.
sentences.chinese: 要让文句切中要点，最好的方法就是用第三人称写作。

sentences.english: The proposal of every literary theory by Yang Shen can hit the social problems of the times.
sentences.chinese: 杨慎每个文章理论观点的提出，皆能切中时弊。

sentences.english: The strangely sermonic tone that this speech assumes is, I think, exactly the point.
sentences.chinese: 演说中奇怪的布道式的语气，我认为，刚好切中要点。

sentences.english: The book diagnoses our present economic ills.
sentences.chinese: 这本书切中了我们现在经济的时弊。

sentences.english: It was cleanly typed, single-spaced, and to the point.
sentences.chinese: 那封信打字工整清晰，行间留一行距离，切中要点。

sentences.english: As far as the study of English was concerned, what he said was of no point.
sentences.chinese: 就学习英语而言，他所讲的并未切中要害。

definition: to hit the target and do real damage (idiom)/fig. to hit where it hurts/fig. to hit home/an argument that hits the nail on the head
lit. to draw blood on the first prick (idiom)/fig. to hit the nail on the head
to hit home on the evils of the day (idiom); fig. to hit a current political target/to hit the nub of the matter
to stick closely to (a topic or theme etc)
to critique/to voice concerns about/ancient form of acupuncture using sharp stones as needles
place of interest/a place one has one's eye on
